param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the account details for the {AccountSid}.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account

param.name: FriendlyName
param.doc: The human-readable description of an account.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Allows you to modify the 'FriendlyName' for the {AccountSid} via POST.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account

param.name: FriendlyName
param.doc: The human-readable description of an account.

method.name: PUT
method.doc: Allows you to modify the 'FriendlyName' for the {AccountSid} via PUT.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Right now, your credentials are tied to one and only one account, so the list resource only contains your single account.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account.

param.name: From
param.doc: A Twilio number enabled for SMS. Only phone numbers purchased from Twilio work here; you cannot (for example) spoof SMS messages from your own cell phone number.

param.name: To
param.doc: The number to call. Format with a '+' and country code e.g., +16175551212 (E.164 format). Twilio will also accept unformatted US numbers e.g., (415) 555-1212, 415-555-1212.

param.name: Body
param.doc: The text of the message you want to send, limited to 160 characters.

param.name: StatusCallback
param.doc: A URL that Twilio will POST to when your message is processed. Twilio will POST the SmsSid as well as SmsStatus=sent or SmsStatus=failed.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Send a new outgoing message.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account

param.name: From
param.doc: Only show SMS messages from this phone number

param.name: To
param.doc: Only show SMS messages to this phone number.

param.name: DateSent
param.doc: Only show SMS messages sent on this date, given as YYYY-MM-DD. Example: DateSent=2009-07-06. You can also specify inequality, such as DateSent lt YYYY-MM-DD for SMS messages that were sent on or before midnight on a date, and DateSent gt YYYY-MM-DD for SMS messages sent on or after midnight on a date.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of SMS messages associated with your account identified by {AccountSid}.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account

param.name: SMSMessageSid
param.doc: Represents a 34 character string that uniquely identifies this SMSMessage

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a single SMS message specified by the provided {SMSMessageSid}.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: PhoneNumber
param.doc: Only show the caller id resource that exactly matches this phone number.

param.name: FriendlyName
param.doc: Only show the caller id resource that exactly matches this name.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the list of outgoing caller ids for this account

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: PhoneNumber
param.doc: The phone number to verify. Should be formatted with a '+' and country code e.g., +16175551212 (E.164 format). Twilio will also accept unformatted US numbers e.g., (415) 555-1212, 415-555-1212.

param.name: FriendlyName
param.doc: A human readable description for the new caller ID with maximum length 64 characters. Defaults to a nicely formatted version of the number.

param.name: CallDelay
param.doc: The number of seconds, between 0 and 60, to delay before initiating the validation call. Defaults to 0.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Adds a new caller id to your account

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: OutgoingCallerIdSid
param.doc: Represents a 34 character string that uniquely identifies this caller Id

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a single outgoing caller id specified by the provided {OutgoingCallerIdSid}

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: OutgoingCallerIdSid
param.doc: Represents a 34 character string that uniquely identifies this caller Id

param.name: FriendlyName
param.doc: A human readable description of a Caller ID, with maximum length of 64 characters. Defaults to a nicely formatted version of the phone number.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Updates the outgoing caller id specified by the provided {OutgoingCallerIdSid} and returns the updated resource if successful via POST.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: OutgoingCallerIdSid
param.doc: Represents a 34 character string that uniquely identifies this caller Id

param.name: FriendlyName
param.doc: A human readable description of a Caller ID, with maximum length of 64 characters. Defaults to a nicely formatted version of the phone number.

method.name: PUT
method.doc: Updates the outgoing caller id specified by the provided {OutgoingCallerIdSid} and returns the updated resource if successful via PUT.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: OutgoingCallerIdSid
param.doc: Represents a 34 character string that uniquely identifies this caller Id

method.name: DELETE
method.doc: Deletes the outgoing caller id specified by the provided {OutgoingCallerIdSid}

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: IsoCountryCode
param.doc: The ISO country code of this phone number

param.name: AreaCode
param.doc: Find phone numbers in the specified Area Code. Only available for North American numbers.

param.name: Contains
param.doc: A pattern to match phone numbers on. Valid characters are '*' and [0-9a-zA-Z]. The '*' character will match any single digit.

param.name: InRegion
param.doc: Limit results to a particular region (i.e. State/Province). Given a phone number, search within the same Region as that number.

param.name: InPostalCode
param.doc: Limit results to a particular postal code. Given a phone number, search within the same postal code as that number.

param.name: NearLatLong
param.doc: Given a latitude/longitude pair lat,long find geographically close numbers within Distance miles.

param.name: NearNumber
param.doc: Given a phone number, find a geographically close number within Distance miles. Distance defaults to 25 miles.

param.name: InLata
param.doc: Limit results to a specific Local access and transport area (LATA). Given a phone number, search within the same LATA as that number.

param.name: InRateCenter
param.doc: Limit results to a specific rate center, or given a phone number search within the same rate center as that number. Requires InLata to be set as well.

param.name: Distance
param.doc: Specifies the search radius for a Near- query in miles. If not specified this defaults to 25 miles.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of local AvailablePhoneNumber resource representations, each representing a phone number that is currently available for provisioning within your account.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: IsoCountryCode
param.doc: The ISO country code of this phone number

param.name: Contains
param.doc: A pattern to match phone numbers on. Valid characters are '*' and [0-9a-zA-Z]. The '*' character will match any single digit.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of toll-free AvailablePhoneNumber resource representations, each representing a phone number that is currently available for provisioning within your account.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: CallSid
param.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the single Call resource identified by {CallSid}.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: CallSid
param.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource

param.name: Url
param.doc: A valid URL that returns TwiML. Twilio will immediately redirect the call to the new TwiML.

param.name: Method
param.doc: The HTTP method Twilio should use when requesting the above URL. Defaults to POST.

param.name: Status
param.doc: Either canceled or completed. Specifying canceled will attempt to hangup calls that are queued or ringing but not affect calls already in progress. Specifying completed will attempt to hang up a call even if it's already in progress.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Modifies a live call. Modification could be redirection or termination of the call.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: To
param.doc: Only show calls to this phone number.

param.name: From
param.doc: Only show calls from this phone number.

param.name: Status
param.doc: Only show calls currently in this status. May be queued, ringing, in-progress, completed, failed, busy, or no-answer.

param.name: StartTime
param.doc: Only show calls that started on this date, given as YYYY-MM-DD. Also supports inequalities, such as StartTime(less than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for calls that started at or before midnight on a date, and StartTime(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for calls that started at or after midnight on a date.

param.name: EndTime
param.doc: Only show calls that ended on this date, given as YYYY-MM-DD. Also supoprts inequalities, such as EndTime(less than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for calls that ended at or before midnight on a date, and EndTime(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for calls that end at or after midnight on a date.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of phone calls made to and from the account identified by {AccountSid}, sorted by DateUpdated with most-recent calls first.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: From
param.doc: The phone number to use as the caller id. Format with a '+' and country code e.g., +16175551212 (E.164 format). Must be a Twilio number or a valid outgoing caller id for your account.

param.name: To
param.doc: The number to call formatted with a '+' and country code e.g., +16175551212 (E.164 format). Twilio will also accept unformatted US numbers e.g., (415) 555-1212, 415-555-1212.

param.name: Url
param.doc: The fully qualified URL that should be consulted when the call connects. Just like when you set a URL for your inbound calls.

param.name: Method
param.doc: The HTTP method Twilio should use when requesting the required Url parameter's value above. Defaults to POST.

param.name: FallbackUrl
param.doc: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML at Url.

param.name: FallbackMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method that Twilio should use to request the FallbackUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: StatusCallback
param.doc: A URL that Twilio will request when the call ends to notify your app.

param.name: StatusCallbackMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method Twilio should use when requesting the above URL. Defaults to POST.

param.name: SendDigits
param.doc: A string of keys to dial after connecting to the number. Valid digits in the string include: any digit (0-9), '#' and '*'. For example, if you connected to a company phone number, and wanted to dial extension 1234 and then the pound key, use SendDigits=1234#. Remember to URL-encode this string, since the '#' character has special meaning in a URL.

param.name: IfMachine
param.doc: Tell Twilio to try and determine if a machine (like voicemail) or a human has answered the call. Possible values are Continue and Hangup. See the answering machines section below for more info.

param.name: Timeout
param.doc: The integer number of seconds that Twilio should allow the phone to ring before assuming there is no answer. Default is 60 seconds, the maximum is 999 seconds. Note, you could set this to a low value, such as 15, to hangup before reaching an answering machine or voicemail. Also see the answering machine section for other solutions.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Make a call.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id.

param.name: IncomingPhoneNumberSid
param.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Fetches the details of a phone number purchased from Twilio

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id.

param.name: IncomingPhoneNumberSid
param.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource.

param.name: FriendlyName
param.doc: A human readable description of the new incoming phone number resource, with maximum length 64 characters.

param.name: ApiVersion
param.doc: Calls to this phone number will start a new TwiML session with this API version. Either 2010-04-01 or 2008-08-01.

param.name: VoiceUrl
param.doc: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody dials the phone number.

param.name: VoiceMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the VoiceUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: VoiceFallbackUrl
param.doc: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML defined by VoiceUrl.

param.name: VoiceFallbackMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the VoiceFallbackUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: StatusCallback
param.doc: The URL that Twilio will request to pass status parameters (such as call ended) to your application.

param.name: StatusCallbackMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method Twilio will use to make requests to the StatusCallback URL. Either GET or POST.

param.name: SmsUrl
param.doc: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody sends an SMS to the new phone number.

param.name: SmsMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: SmsFallbackUrl
param.doc: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML defined by SmsUrl.

param.name: SmsFallbackMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsFallbackUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: VoiceCallerIdLookup
param.doc: Do a lookup of a caller's name from the CNAM database and post it to your app. Either true or false. Defaults to false.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Update an incoming phone number obtained from Twilio via POST.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id.

param.name: IncomingPhoneNumberSid
param.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource.

param.name: FriendlyName
param.doc: A human readable description of the new incoming phone number resource, with maximum length 64 characters.

param.name: ApiVersion
param.doc: Calls to this phone number will start a new TwiML session with this API version. Either 2010-04-01 or 2008-08-01.

param.name: VoiceUrl
param.doc: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody dials the phone number.

param.name: VoiceMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the VoiceUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: VoiceFallbackUrl
param.doc: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML defined by VoiceUrl.

param.name: VoiceFallbackMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the VoiceFallbackUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: StatusCallback
param.doc: The URL that Twilio will request to pass status parameters (such as call ended) to your application.

param.name: StatusCallbackMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method Twilio will use to make requests to the StatusCallback URL. Either GET or POST.

param.name: SmsUrl
param.doc: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody sends an SMS to the new phone number.

param.name: SmsMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: SmsFallbackUrl
param.doc: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML defined by SmsUrl.

param.name: SmsFallbackMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsFallbackUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: VoiceCallerIdLookup
param.doc: Do a lookup of a caller's name from the CNAM database and post it to your app. Either true or false. Defaults to false.

method.name: PUT
method.doc: Update an incoming phone number obtained from Twilio via PUT.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id.

param.name: IncomingPhoneNumberSid
param.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely idetifies this resource.

method.name: DELETE
method.doc: Deletes a phone number purchased from Twilio

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id.

param.name: PhoneNumber
param.doc: Only show the incoming phone number resources that match this pattern. You can specify partial numbers and use '*' as a wildcard for any digit.

param.name: FriendlyName
param.doc: Only show the incoming phone number resources with friendly names that exactly match this name.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of incoming phone number resources, each representing a phone number given to your account

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id.

param.name: PhoneNumber
param.doc: The phone number you want to purchase. The number should be formated starting with a '+' followed by the country code and the number in E.164 format

param.name: FriendlyName
param.doc: A human readable description of the new incoming phone number. Maximum 64 characters. Defaults to a formatted version of the number.

param.name: VoiceUrl
param.doc: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody dials the new phone number.

param.name: VoiceMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the VoiceUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: VoiceFallbackUrl
param.doc: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML at Url.

param.name: VoiceFallbackMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the VoiceFallbackUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: StatusCallback
param.doc: The URL that Twilio will request to pass status parameters (such as call ended) to your application.

param.name: StatusCallbackMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method Twilio will use to make requests to the StatusCallback URL. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: SmsUrl
param.doc: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody sends an SMS to the phone number.

param.name: SmsMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: SmsFallbackUrl
param.doc: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML defined by SmsUrl.

param.name: SmsFallbackMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsFallbackUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: VoiceCallerIdLookup
param.doc: Do a lookup of a caller's name from the CNAM database and post it to your app. Either true or false. Defaults to false.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Adds a new phone number to your account. If a phone number is found for your request, Twilio will add it to your account

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id.

param.name: AreaCode
param.doc: The area code in which you'd like a new incoming phone number. Any three digit, US area code is valid. Twilio will provision a random phone number within this area code for you. You must include either this or a PhoneNumber parameter to have your POST succeed.

param.name: FriendlyName
param.doc: A human readable description of the new incoming phone number. Maximum 64 characters. Defaults to a formatted version of the number.

param.name: VoiceUrl
param.doc: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody dials the new phone number.

param.name: VoiceMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the VoiceUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: VoiceFallbackUrl
param.doc: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML at Url.

param.name: VoiceFallbackMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the VoiceFallbackUrl. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: StatusCallback
param.doc: The URL that Twilio will request to pass status parameters (such as call ended) to your application.

param.name: StatusCallbackMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method Twilio will use to make requests to the StatusCallback URL. Either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: SmsUrl
param.doc: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody sends an SMS to the phone number.

param.name: SmsMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: SmsFallbackUrl
param.doc: A URL that Twilio will request if an error occurs requesting or executing the TwiML defined by SmsUrl.

param.name: SmsFallbackMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsFallbackUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: VoiceCallerIdLookup
param.doc: Do a lookup of a caller's name from the CNAM database and post it to your app. Either true or false. Defaults to false.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Adds a random phone number available for the area depending on the Area Code provided

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: CallSid
param.doc: Show only recordings made during the call given by this sid.

param.name: DateCreated
param.doc: Only show recordings created on the given date. Should be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. You can also specify inequality, such as DateCreated(less than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for recordings generated at or before midnight on a date, and DateCreated(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for recordings generated at or after midnight on a date.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a recording list for the {CallSid}

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: CallSid
param.doc: Show only recordings made during the call given by this sid.

param.name: DateCreated
param.doc: Only show recordings created on the given date. Should be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. You can also specify inequality, such as DateCreated(less than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for recordings generated at or before midnight on a date, and DateCreated(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for recordings generated at or after midnight on a date.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a recording list associated with this {AccountSid}

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: RecordingSid
param.doc: The unique id of the Recording this Transcription was made of

method.name: GET
method.doc: Each Recording instance resource has a Transcriptions subresource which represents the set of transcriptions generated from the recording (if any). Represents the set of transcriptions available for the recording identified by {RecordingSid}.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: TranscriptionSid
param.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this resource

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a single Transcription resource representation identified by the given {TranscriptionSid}.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a set of Transcription resource representations that includes paging information, sorted by 'DateUpdated', with most recent transcripts first.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: RecordingSid
param.doc: The unique id of the Recording this Transcription was made of

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a recording

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: RecordingSid
param.doc: The unique id of the Recording this Transcription was made of

method.name: DELETE
method.doc: Deletes a recording

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: NotificationSid
param.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this resource.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a notification

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: NotificationSid
param.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this resource.

method.name: DELETE
method.doc: Deletes a notification

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: Log
param.doc: Only show notifications for this log, using the integer log values shown above.

param.name: MessageDate
param.doc: Only show notifications for this date. Should be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. You can also specify inequality, such as MessageDate(less than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for messages logged at or before midnight on a date, and MessageDate(greater than or equal to )YYYY-MM-DD for messages logged at or after midnight on a date. When performing a date range query with day-granularity make sure the right endpoint is midnight of the next day (e.g. to construct a range query for all calls on YYYY-MM-DD use MessageDate(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD(and)MessageDate(less than)YYYY-MM-(DD+1)).

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a notification list

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: CallSid
param.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this resource

param.name: Log
param.doc: Only show notifications for this log, using the integer log values shown above.

param.name: MessageDate
param.doc: Only show notifications for this date. Should be formatted as YYYY-MM-DD. You can also specify inequality, such as MessageDate(less than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for messages logged at or before midnight on a date, and MessageDate(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for messages logged at or after midnight on a date. When performing a date range query with day-granularity make sure the right endpoint is midnight of the next day (e.g. to construct a range query for all calls on YYYY-MM-DD use MessageDate(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD(and)MessageDate(less than)YYYY-MM-(DD+1)).

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a notification list

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: ConferenceSid
param.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this conference.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a representation of the conference identified by {ConferenceSid}.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: ConferenceSid
param.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this conference.

param.name: Muted
param.doc: Only show participants that are muted or unmuted. Either true or false.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the list of participants in the conference identified by {ConferenceSid}.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: Status
param.doc: Only show conferences currently in with this status. May be init, in-progress, or completed.

param.name: FriendlyName
param.doc: List conferences who's FriendlyName is the exact match of this string.

param.name: DateCreated
param.doc: Only show conferences that started on this date, given as YYYY-MM-DD. You can also specify inequality, such as DateCreated(less than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for conferences that started at or before midnight on a date, and DateCreated(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for conferences that started at or after midnight on a date.

param.name: DateUpdated
param.doc: Only show conferences that were last updated on this date, given as YYYY-MM-DD. You can also specify inequality, such as DateUpdated(less than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for conferences that were last updated at or before midnight on a date, and DateUpdated(greater than or equal to)YYYY-MM-DD for conferences that were updated at or after midnight on a date.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a list of conferences within an account identified by {AccountSid}.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: ConferenceSid
param.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this conference.

param.name: CallSid
param.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies the call that is connected to this conference.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns a representation of this participant.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: ConferenceSid
param.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this conference.

param.name: CallSid
param.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies the call that is connected to this conference.

param.name: Muted
param.doc: Specifying true will mute the participant, while false will un-mute.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Mute a participant.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: ConferenceSid
param.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this conference.

param.name: CallSid
param.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies the call that is connected to this conference.

method.name: DELETE
method.doc: Kick a participant from a conference.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: ConferenceSid
param.doc: A 34 character string that uniquely identifies this conference.

param.name: Muted
param.doc: Only show participants that are muted or unmuted. Either true or false.

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the list of participants in the conference identified by {ConferenceSid}.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

method.name: GET
method.doc: Returns the Sandbox resource associated with the account identified by {AccountSid}.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.name: VoiceMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the above URL. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: SmsUrl
param.doc: The URL that Twilio should request when somebody sends an SMS to the sandbox.

param.name: SmsMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

method.name: POST
method.doc: Updates the Sandbox resource via POST.

param.name: AccountSid
param.doc: Represents the unique id of the Account responsible for this caller Id

param.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the above URL. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

param.name: SmsMethod
param.doc: The HTTP method that should be used to request the SmsUrl. Must be either GET or POST. Defaults to POST.

method.name: PUT
method.doc: Updates the Sandbox resource via PUT.
